boardgame.description: Mah-Jongg (Chinese 麻將/麻将 M_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;aacute;ji_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;agrave;ng [game of the] sparrow) is a traditional Chinese game using illustrated tiles, with game play similarities to rummy. It is a popular gambling game, but wagering real stakes is by no means necessary to have fun playing._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The tiles consist of three suits numbering 1-9 (Dots, Numbers or Characters, and Bamboo, the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Ace_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; of which almost always looks like a bird), three different dragons (Red, Green, and White [white is unusual in that it may look like a silvery dragon, or like a picture frame, or blank - think _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;White dragon in a snowstorm_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;), and the four winds (east, south, west, and north). There are four copies of each tile. This totals to 136 tiles. In addition, special Flower, Season, and Joker (American version) tiles may also be used._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Four players take turns drawing from a stock (the wall), or from the other players' discards, in an attempt to form sets of numeric sequences (e.g., 5-6-7 of the same suit, which can only be drawn from the player at one's left, by calling _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Chow_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;), triplets and quadruplets (which can be drawn from the discards out-of-turn by calling _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Pung_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;), pairs, and other patterns. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Pung_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; takes precedence over _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Chow_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;, and _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Mah Jongg_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; takes precedence over all (and is the only situation one may draw _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Chow_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; out-of-turn.) What happens if a single discard would give two (or more!) players _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Mah Jongg_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;? Precedence goes to the player who would play next in normal sequence._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Originating in China in the mid-19th century, it was introduced to the U.S. in the 1920s. It is now played in different forms throughout Asia, Europe, North America, Australia, and New Zealand. Although the rules for game play are fairly constant, there are an immense variety of scoring schemes. A few general categories of rule-sets include: Chinese Classical, Hong Kong Old Style, Japanese, Taiwanese, Western, and American._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

listing.notes: Reserved for Auction Winner: George Buss (ThatFedoraGuy) Nice Mah Jongg set in oak case roughly 21x9x4. Case contains four oak tile racks with metal bars plus tiles, dice, chips, and instructions. The 166 tiles include 10 jokers and 4 blanks. Tiles are roughly 1.25 x 0.875 x 0.5. There are also three six sided dice, one special six sided die with characters on it, and a little die holder. The chips are multicolored translucent plastic, and styled after old chinese coins. This set weighs 11.5 pounds before packaging. Pictures available on request. Non-Paypal payment accepted in U.S. funds only.

***New Lower Price!!!*** New Bone and Bamboo set in a standard cloth box including counting sticks, dice, and wind indicator (bettor). This set features pieces with a bone face dovetailed into a bamboo backing. This set includes numbers on all pieces so that non-Chinese speakers can play. This set is intended for use with the Chinese style game, but it includes 4 Jokers and 4 Blanks so that you could very easily (and correctly) use it for the American or Western games. Compare this price to others around the internet; it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s very low for a bone-and-bamboo set. This set has never been used, so all the pieces look their original bright white. I can accept Paypal if necessary. Please add 5% if you wish to use this service. Plenty of other payment methods are also availible.
Nice faux-ivory in leatherette case. Case handle slightly damaged, contents excellent. A very nice household set.

This is an item won by user marvac in my recent Geekbay auction; that is the only person who may purchase it. Approximate weight _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; size (not counting the shipping box): 3 lb. 2 oz; 15.5_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; x 8_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; x 1.75_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;. Paypal preferred, but other means OK; all money must clear before items are shipped.
This is a private sale for thatthing1999. This is a game that was won on my GeekList auction. I will only accept the sale if the game is purchased by thatthing1999!
For user kdean1, auction win.
Gibsons Games Green box edition. Box has some wear, but components are in really good condition.
Mah Jongg: The Card Game from Winning Moves. Opened but never played. All components are accounted for.

This looks like a hand-painted set. The box says _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Mah-Jongg Sales Co. of America_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;. I count 144 wooden tiles, 2 small d6 and 128 cardboard discs. There are no rules in the box. for Jake11Simon only
Gibsons Games Green Box Edition. Box shows extensive wear, but components in good condition.

Vintage Mah Jong game set by Futami Kogeisha Japan, with a booklet prepared expressly for this set (last date in book is 8th printing 1961) entitled Mah Jong for Beginners by Shozo Kanai _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Margaret Farrell, Charles E. Tuttle Company. Tiles new in Shrink. One snap from the vinyl snap case is missing. Sold in my auction to BGG User: eapeas If you are not them, please do not add this to your cart.

Winning Moves (WNM1153) Millions of players and fascinated by Mah Jongg, the enchanting game of luck and skill. Now, instead of using heavy and very expensive tiles, you can experience the game with these beautiful custom designed cards!
Reserved for Arduinceo (auction win). Also includes Backgammon set.
Set for Anglotiger! BAMBOO, BABY!
